question: What is an Escape Sequence in C language.?
option1: A) An escape sequence is a combination of two characters starting with Back Slash always.
option2: B) An escape sequence is usually part of a string to tell compiler to produce New Lines, New tabs, Single or Double quotes etc
option3: C) An escape sequence is used to format the output to look in desired way.

question: Choose a correct statement about C Escape Sequences.
option2: B) \t produces one tab space (white spaces)

question: Choose a correct statement about C Escape Sequences.
option1: A) \r produces one Carriage Return. \r does not take you to the next line. It takes cursor to only the beginning of same line.
option3: C) \a produces Alert Sound or Beep Sound from PC motherboard speaker

question: Choose a correct statement about C Escape Sequences.
option1: A) \' outputs one Single Quote. Right Single Quote.
option3: C) \\ produces one Visible Back Slash \.

question: What is a format specifier in C language.?
option1: A) A format Specifier tells compiler to treat a variable value is predefined way.
option2: B) Different format specifiers are used to print different type of data.
option3: C) Format specifiers are used to write data to files in a formatted way.

question: Choose a valid C format specifier.?
option3: C) %ld prints signed long and %lu prints unsigned long constants

question: Choose a correct statement about C format Specifiers.
option1: A) %c prints unsigned or signed character constants.

question: Choose a correct statement about format specifiers.
option1: A) %f prints float constants with 6 digits of precision

question: What does C format specifier %W.D represent.?
option1: A) W represents total number of columns including precision digits.
option2: B) D represents number of precision digits out of W columns.
option3: C) Plus(+) before W.D is for Right Alignment. Minus(-) before W.D is for Left Alignment

question: Choose a C Formatted Input Output function below.
Choose a C unformatted input output function below.

Choose a correct statement about sprintf and sscanf functions.?
char str[20];
option1: A) sprintf(str,"formatstring",variables) prints output to console. sscanf(str,"formatstring",&variables) scans keyboard input and copies to str.
option2: B) sprintf(str,"formatstring",variables) prints output to string str. sscanf(str,"formatstring",&variables) scans keyboard input and prints to console
option3: C) sprintf(str,"formatstring",variables) prints output to string str. sscanf(str,"formatstring",&variables) scans input from str itself and assigns data to &variables.

question: Choose a correct C statement.?
option1: A) SCANF can accept all types of data from keyboard including numbers and strings
option2: B) GETS can accept only one String of any length and any number of words. GETCHAR can accept only one character constant from keyboard.
option3: C) SCANF can accept only single word Strings
